intro: Alansmia monosora, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. Alansmia monosora is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in Native American herbal practices.
